word_mean: 本能，本性：物种特有的不经学习而具备的一些反应能力

sentence.Network_en: His instinct would be to seek a new accommodation with the nationalists.
sentence.Network_cn: 他本能的反应会是寻求与民族主义者取得新的和解。

sentence.Network_en: She hadn't followed her instinct and because of this Frank was dead.
sentence.Network_cn: 她没有听从自己心里的话，弗兰克因此死了。

sentence.Network_en: Farmers are increasingly losing touch with their instinct for managing the land.
sentence.Network_cn: 农民正在逐渐丢失经营土地的本领。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (also in the sense 'instigation, impulse'): from Latin instinctus 'impulse', from the verb instinguere, from in- 'towards' + stinguere 'to prick'

encyclopedia.content: 专辑简介 专辑名称：Instinct 艺人：Niki & The Dove 语种：英语 唱片公司：Sub Pop Records 发行时间：2012年05月14日 专辑类别：个人专辑 专辑介绍 瑞典组合Niki & The Dove锛埬莼敫胱语級算得上是近来业界的高光人物，从EP发行到一系列运作流程可以看出唱片公司对他们也很上心，今年顺利入围了BBC sound of 2012.音乐方面还是很有北欧乐队的风骨，流畅诡魅不失灵性，歌曲以及MV都会让人联想到他们的前辈与同乡，瑞典

entry.def: Instinct is the natural tendency that a person or animal has to behave or react in a particular way.

example.ex: I didn't have as strong a maternal instinct as some other mothers...
example.tran: 我不像别的母亲那样有那么强烈的母性本能。

example.ex: The basis for training relies on the dog's natural instinct to hunt and retrieve...
example.tran: 训练是基于狗搜寻和衔回的天生本能。

entry.def: If you have an instinct for something, you are naturally good at it or able to do it.

example.ex: Farmers are increasingly losing touch with their instinct for managing the land...
example.tran: 农民正在逐渐丢失经营土地的本领。

example.ex: Irene is so incredibly musical and has a natural instinct to perform.
example.tran: 艾琳有着极高的音乐天分和天生的表演才能。

entry.def: If it is your instinct to do something, you feel that it is right to do it.

example.ex: I should've gone with my first instinct, which was not to do the interview...
example.tran: 我本该听从自己的第一反应,不接受这次采访的。

example.ex: She hadn't followed her instinct and because of this Frank was dead.
example.tran: 她没有听从自己心里的话,弗兰克因此死了。

entry.def: Instinct is a feeling that you have that something is the case, rather than an opinion or idea based on facts.

example.ex: There is scientific evidence to support our instinct that being surrounded by plants is good for health...
example.tran: 我们觉得周围植物环绕会有益健康,这种直觉有科学证据支持。

example.ex: He seems so honest and genuine and my every instinct says he's not.
example.tran: 他看起来这么老实诚恳,但我的全部直觉告诉我他一点都不。

means.word_mean: 1. inborn pattern of behavior often responsive to specific stimuli;

sentences.sentence: "imbued with the spirit of the Reformation"

auth_sentence.content: My motherly instinct tells me I'm probably right.
auth_sentence.res_content: My motherly instinct tells me I'm probably right.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: My motherly instinct tells me I'm probably right.

auth_sentence.content: But instinct has also led her to make mistakes.
auth_sentence.res_content: But instinct has also led her to make mistakes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But instinct has also led her to make mistakes.

auth_sentence.content: It's part of a general instinct to over-emote.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's part of a general instinct to over-emote.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's part of a general instinct to over-emote.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =prick,表示"刺,刺激"; 2. 引申为火焰

stems_affixes.value_cn: 清楚的,明显的;[from]截然不同的
stems_affixes.word_buile: dis分开+stinct刺,刺激→把刺分开→明显的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 特别的;有特色的;与众不同的
stems_affixes.word_buile: distinct[adj.清楚的,明显的;[from]截然不同的]+ive表形容词→adj.特别的;有特色的;与众不同的
instinct[n.本能,直觉,天性]+ive表形容词→adj.本能的
distinct清楚的,明显的+ly表副词→adv.清楚地, 显然

stems_affixes.value_cn: 区别,差别;级别;特性;声望;显赫
stems_affixes.word_buile: distinct[adj.清楚的,明显的;[from]截然不同的]+ion表名词→n.区别,差别;级别;特性;声望;显赫
in内+stinct刺,刺激→内在的刺激,本能
in内+stig=stinct刺,刺激+ate使……→刺激别人内部→煽动

means.word_mean: 本能; 天性; 直觉

sentences.en: The sight of the hopeless little boy aroused her maternal instincts.
sentences.cn: 那个绝望的小男孩的模样唤起了她的母性。

sentences.en: Don't ask me;  follow your instincts and do what you think is right.
sentences.cn: 不要问我, 凭你自己的直觉行事, 你认为什么是对的就去做什么。

jushi.english: Don't ask me; follow your instincts and do what you think is right.
jushi.chinese: 不要问我,凭你自己的直觉行事,你认为什么是对的就去做什么。

jushi.english: Instinct led the pigeons back to the roost.
jushi.chinese: 鸽子的本能使它们返回鸽棚。
